name: Define Variables
description: Identify the variables for the cost of the bottle and the cap. Let C represent the cost of the cap and B represent the cost of the bottle.
expected_output: Variables defined: C (cap cost), B (bottle cost)

name: Set Up Equations
description: Formulate the equations based on the problem statement: (1) B + C = 110 and (2) B = C + 100.
expected_output: Equations established: B + C = 110; B = C + 100

name: Substitute and Rearrange
description: Substitute the value of B from the second equation into the first equation and rearrange to solve for C.
expected_output: Rearranged equation results in a single equation in C.

name: Solve for C
description: Calculate the value of C, which represents the cost of the cap, using the rearranged equation.
expected_output: C, the cost of the cap, determined.

name: Confirm Result
description: Verify that the values of C and B satisfy both original equations and confirm that the solution makes sense in the context.
expected_output: Both original equations satisfied: B + C = 110 and B - C = 100.
